ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic triad of hypoparathyroidism, thymic aplasia/hypoplasia, and T-cell lymphocytopenia matches perfectly with patient presentation. All three reference cases with similar features were diagnosed with DiGeorge syndrome.
Overlaps significantly with DiGeorge syndrome as most cases are caused by 22q11.2 deletion. Presents with the same core features of thymic hypoplasia, hypoparathyroidism, and immunodeficiency.
Can present with thymic hypoplasia and immunodeficiency, though hypoparathyroidism is less common. Missing other typical features like coloboma, heart defects, and choanal atresia.
Rare cause of DiGeorge-like phenotype with hypoparathyroidism and thymic hypoplasia, but typically includes additional features not present in this patient.
Can rarely present with thymic hypoplasia and immunodeficiency, but typically has severe neurological manifestations and hepatomegaly which are not reported here.
